name: Werewolves and Other Werecreatures Quiz | Humanities | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is the psychological term for a person who thinks that he is a wolf?
From what material were werewolf-slaying instruments supposed to be fashioned?
questions.explanation:
Silver.

	Silver probably got this reputation because of its supposed purity and association with the moon.

questions.text: Quite a few physical signs were taken to be indications that one was a werewolf. Which of the following was NOT a sign that one harbored 'the animal within'?
questions.correct: Eyes that reflect red light in the dark
options: Eyebrows that meet over the bridge of the nose
questions.explanation:
Eyes that reflect red light in the dark.

	Other signs are an unusually long third finger, tattoos in the shape of a crescent moon, an uncut, clawlike left thumbnail, and tiredness in the morning.

questions.text: One of the common beliefs about werewolves is that if you are bitten by one, you will also become a werewolf. What viral disease is responsible for this belief?
questions.explanation:
rabies & hydrophobia.

	Rabid wolves often foam at the mouth and bite whatever crosses their path. After the bite, a human who contracts rabies may exhibit the same behavior.

questions.text: What do you call a werewolf from the southern United States?
questions.explanation:
Loup garou.

	There are many Cajun legends and songs about the 'loup garou', which is often said to resemble a rabid dog.

questions.text: In Japan, many legends tell of the kitsune, who often appeared in the form of a beautiful woman. The kitsune was a ....
questions.explanation:
Werefox.

	The kitsune often had many tails. The more tails she had, the older and wiser she was.

questions.text: In the Amazon, one hears legends of the 'boto', which can transform into a young boy or a handsome man. In animal form, the boto is a...
questions.explanation:
Dolphin.

	In the Amazon, a dolphin called the 'pink dolphin' can be found. Legends about this creature abound.

questions.text: In Celtic folklore, men were often seduced by the selkies, beautiful women who were really...
questions.explanation:
Seals.

	The selkie turned into a woman by removing her sealskin. If a man stole the skin, the selkie could not transform.

questions.text: In 1992, a poll of Russians found that ____________ of respondents believed that werewolves existed.
questions.explanation:
80 percent.

	The werewolf story has long been a staple tale of Russia, where wolves were (and still are, in many places) plentiful.

questions.text: Today, some people truly believe that they are humans with the souls of animals. What do such people call their belief system?
questions.explanation:
Spiritual therianthropy.

	Many Internet sites are dedicated to these beliefs.
